name: Warhammer® 40,000: Dawn of War® – Winter Assault
description: This expansion adds all-new units and strategies to the exciting gameplay offered by Dawn of War. The Imperial Guard brings new weaponry, including heavy armor, new troop units as well as defensive and ranged tactics overwhelming numbers. Coupled with new abilities, this fighting force is as lethal as they come.
minimum_requirements: Windows 2000/XP, 1.8 Ghz Intel Pentium III or equivalent AMD Athlon XP, 256 MB RAM, 4.5 GB free hard drive space, 32 MB DirectX 9.0c compatible AGP video card with Hardware Transformation and Lighting, 16-bit DirectX 9.0b compatible sound card, Mouse, Keyboard Recommended: 2.4 GHz Intel Pentium 4 or equivalent, 512 MB system RAM (required for 8-player multiplayer games), nVidia GeForce 3 or ATI Radeon 8500 or equivalent with 64 MB of Video RAM  Required for Multiplayer:  Internet: Cable modem, DSL modem, or 56.6 kbps modem for online multiplayer play; Network: TCP/IP compliant network

reviews.review_text: Imperial Guard Reinforcement Simulator 10/10 :D But serously this game is great.

An expansion pack to the original Dawn Of War, this features many races to play as. There are two campaigns, the Forces Of Order and the Campaign Of Disorder. The gameplay rules are pretty much the same as the first DoW, and as the title says, you are always facing down winter in the different snow capped battlefields you fight on. Players who want to know the full story of the DoW series in order should play this after they play the original DoW, because what happens in this version connects with other games in the DoW series (not telling which one, you have to find out yourself!). Good game.

Overall a decent game. it definately feels like a full expansion, giving you the option to play the 'order' or 'disorder' campaigns with 5 missions for each. However, i had a tough time with the campaigns, mainly the 'order' campaign. There are small bugs here and there, but nothing that will ruin your game experience. If you're a fan of the Warhammer 40K franchise and looking for a fun, yet challenging story, this game is for you.
Hard as nails compared to the base game, and the levels tend to be massive footslogs through hell for the Guard. Just as it should be!  8/10 'Anything for the Imperium!'

So Figured I'd write something more than 'this Xpac sucks!'  1. The campaign is just... bad - The split story is not only bad, but the overall plot definitely feels thrown together. I know they were going for 'play thing other than spess mahrines!' but common.... 2. Everything this does, the other expansions do way better - The Necron expansion is probably the best of the three, but you can basically skip this xpac 3. Its short - Like.... way short. I think I finished this xpac in a couple hours playing Chaos, but hated it so much I didn't even try with the Imp Guard.  This is coming from a 40k fan.... I love 40k, and while the tabletop was ruined by 6th and overpriced models (personal opinion) I still love the setting and story, so will continue to support it with the games. That said, this Xpac is definitely not worth your time if you have the GOTY edition; skip ahead to soulstorm or the other one, your not missing much here.
This was my first game that I actually remember playing.The nastalgia made me cry.I burst out crying, I remembered my childhood, I want it back!!

This game is a lot like the original Dawn of War in terms of gameplay. However the campaign is awful. It's only five missions long. You can play as Order (Imperial Guard and Eldar) or Disorder (Orcs and Chaos).  Order campaign has a bunch of sections where you control an Imperial Guard base. I personally hate Imperial Guard. They seem really underpowered and weak. And the Eldar parts are basically hero missions.   Disorder campaign has a really annoying 3rd mission.  Both campaigns are essentially the same story/content wise with only some differences which I mentioned. Both sides have a really confusing 4th mission where you have to switch back and forth between the two races. The transition is very choppy and annoying.

Sadly this game doesn't continue the story of the first dawn of war, but this time you got choices! There are 2 campaigns, order and disorder. Order is hard, since you get the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ imperials, but you get eldars! Dis-order is fun because you get badass Chaos and WAAAAAAAAAAAGH!! of orcs. PS (the story of first dawn of war continues in dawn of war 2)
